title: How to Configure Mozilla Thunderbird for Yahoo! Mail

steps.title: Open Yahoo's secure login page.
steps.content: Open Yahoo's secure login page. Go to https://login.yahoo.com/account/security?scrumb=qdwntcNeyBy and log in with your Yahoo email address and password. If you've recently logged into Yahoo, you may not need to log in.

steps.title: Click the "Allow apps that use less secure sign in" switch .
steps.content: Click the "Allow apps that use less secure sign in" switch . It's in the bottom-right side of the page. This will allow you to use Thunderbird with Yahoo.

steps.title: Open Thunderbird.
steps.content: Open Thunderbird. It's an icon that resembles a blue bird atop a grey globe.

steps.title: Click Email.
steps.content: Click Email . You'll find this in the middle of the home page. A pop-up window will appear.

steps.title: Click Skip this and use my existing email.
steps.content: Click Skip this and use my existing email . It's in the bottom-left corner of the pop-up window.

steps.title: Enter your Yahoo email address and password .
steps.content: Enter your Yahoo email address and password . Click the "Email address" text field, then type in your Yahoo email address, then click the "Password" text field, then type in your Yahoo email address' password.

steps.title: Click Continue.
steps.content: Click Continue . It's at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Select a storage type.
steps.content: Select a storage type. Click a checkbox next to one of the storage options: IMAP - Keeps your email in your Yahoo inbox, allowing Thunderbird to synchronize with Yahoo when you're connected to the Internet. POP3 - Stores your email on your computer.

steps.title: Click Done.
steps.content: Click Done . Doing so will sign you into your Yahoo account in Thunderbird. Your computer will begin synchronizing Thunderbird and Yahoo. If you use POP3 instead of IMAP , you may need to click your email address in the upper-left side of the page and then click Read messages to open your inbox for the first time.
